Subjective: Heart palpitations; rapid breathing; tension in body; stiff muscles; stress-related symptoms; difficulty saying no to work demands; guilt feelings when saying no; sleep problems; worrying and fretting about next day; uncertainty about work; fatigue; difficulty relaxing. No fever, chest pain, irregular heartbeat, dizziness, or light-headedness. Worried about health and wants to rule out physical causes. Wants to discuss with a professional (mental health nurse) and take care of herself during busy work period.
Objective: Vitals: BP 120/60; HR 65; O2 98%; RR 14. Physical exam: normal heart sounds; no murmurs; good breath sound across all lung fields; no abdominal complaints.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms, susp. work-related burnout. No signs of anaemia, thyroid dysfunction, or other somatic causes.
Plan: Conduct additional examination: blood test (haemoglobin, thyroid values, liver and kidney function)
Take care of herself during busy work period: build moments of relaxation into life; maintain regularity in life; try to go to bed on time; enjoy activities that give energy
Consider occupational health and safety service for tips on adjusting work schedule
